content: stripeydoodle bag by shelby rose when i first was learning how to knit i stockpiled acrylic yarn not knowing exactly what project i should cast on first i decided i needed reusable bags this pattern has been modified over the years so many times you really can t screw anything about it up perfect for the adventurous beginner yarn any worsted/aran will do i use red heart super saver in this pattern fiber acrylic will retain its shape and is happy to stretch cotton is lighter but once it stretches it won t go back to its original shape needles 5mm or us 8 circular needle you might want to use dpns for the start or magic loop works as well size 8in in length after working the base not including handles everything is adjustable yardage less than 1 skein gauge 18sts per 4 inches but not crucial techniques knitting in the round purling flat increasing decreasing holding live stitches bind off and 3 needle bind off/grafting notions 8 stitch markers waste yarn and tapestry needle abbreviations bor beginning of row/round rs right side ws wrong side kfb begin by knitting 1 stitch on your working needle but before sliding the stitch off insert the tip of the same needle into the backside of the loop and knit it through the back loop this is +1 stitch k2tog with your working needle insert into next 2 stitches as if to knit wrap yarn and slip_stitch off this is -1 stitch k2tbl with your working needle knit your next 2 stitches together through the back loop this is -1 stitch this is an abbreviated version of ssk pattern cast on 4 stitches and prepare to work in the round round 1 you will be working kfb into each of the stitches as you complete the increase place a stitch marker on your needle make sure your bor stitch marker is different first round completed you now have 8 stitches with markers before and after every 2 stitches round 2 knit all stitches slipping markers as you come to them round 3 *k1 kfb* x4 12 total round 4 repeat round 2 round 5 *k1 kfb k1* x4 16 total round 6 repeat round 2 round 7 *k1 kfb knit to the last two stitches kfb k1 * x4 20 total round 8 repeat round 2 you will continue working round 7 and 8 until you have 26 stitches in each section or total of 104 around this will complete the base and you may remove all stitch markers except your bor knit until your bag reaches 8 inches from your last increase note this portion can be done on dps instead without so many stitch markers you could also skip the first 2 rounds cast on 8 and begin on round 3 this will create a hole that will need to be closed later handles once you have created a bucket you will be casting off some stitches and putting others
